data.text: Our first Boeing 767-300ER, the OE-LAT, has left Vienna today. Before departure Austrian Airlines technical staff wrote greetings on the nose landing gear door of the aircraft. Our crew, which is operating the transfer flight, also said "Servus" once again before takeoff. https://t.co/QOii7k2h0S

data.text: The anniversary flight, operated with our OE-LPA and its new special livery, is taking off today from Vienna heading to Penang. The aircraft will return to Vienna again on February 28 carrying urgently needed protective medical materials.

Since March 2020 Austrian Airlines has established an airlift to Asia on behalf of time:matters to transport relief supplies in the form of protective gloves, masks and suits as well as rapid antigen tests to Vienna, Frankfurt or Linz.

domain.name: Ongoing News Story

data.text: Today Austrian Airlines and the air cargo experts of time:matters, a subsidiary of @Lufthansa_Cargo, celebrated the 100th jointly operated cargo flight with a special livery. To date more than 2,000 tons of relief supplies were flown to Europe from Xiamen, Shanghai and Penang. https://t.co/bmumjD47xi

“MDI is excited to continue the growth of its passenger and cargo aviation portfolio with the addition of three 767-300ERs”, adds MDI’s manager Mary Alice Keyes. “It has been a pleasure to work with Austrian Airlines, a group with a long history and outstanding pedigree.”

“Being able to sell all three Boeing 767s to one buyer is very gratifying and a big step for our fleet transition”, says Austrian Airlines CEO Alexis von Hoensbroech. “I would like to thank MDI for the good negotiations and our team for their great commitment.”

data.text: The first aircraft, registered OE-LAT, will leave Vienna at the beginning of March for Pinal Airpark, Arizona. It is currently undergoing all the necessary preparations for the handover. The next transfer flight is scheduled for May with the Boeing 767 registered OE-LAX.

data.text: Austrian Airlines has found a buyer for the three long-haul aircraft that were up for sale. The Boeing 767-300ER aircraft will go to the US company MonoCoque Diversified Interests. The purchase agreement has already been signed. https://t.co/xLAbRbMc2e

data.text: There will also be a new destination in the 2021 summer flight schedule: For the first time since 2009, Austrian will be flying to @HannoverAirport. The frequency will be continuously increased – from twice weekly until twice a day from July.

"We are expecting increased demand in the tourism sector in summer and are therefore increasing our offer to vacation destinations by up to 20 percent from July", explains Austrian Airlines CCO Michael Trestl. https://t.co/SgyMuTsFeK

data.text: Austrian Airlines plans to slowly increase the flight schedule until summer. More than 20 destinations will be resumed for the summer flight program. In midsummer, Austrian anticipates increased demand for vacation travel and is therefore focusing on tourist destinations. https://t.co/vnZYldsOvl

data.text: Yesterday we flew our OE-LPD, a Boeing 777, to @TeruelAirport, Spain. It's planned to store it there for the coming 12 months. Why Teruel? Because a dry climate is best for long-term storage. We are looking forward to reactivating our "Spirit of Austria" after its hibernation! 👋 https://t.co/Y4W2z83edI

data.text: The Austrian Ministry of Health has imposed a landing ban on flights from the United Kingdom as of Tuesday, 22 December 2020. This regulation is currently valid until including 1 January 2021. During this time we won't operate any regular passenger flights from London to Vienna. https://t.co/cPdKzyWClL

data.text: Today, something special happened during one of our Berlin flights. At 10,000 feet above the ground, Peter gathered all of his courage and asked his girlfriend Nina to become his wife - and she said yes! 💍❤🎉 Congrats to the lovely couple. #LoveIsInTheAir #Servus https://t.co/U4mzgtkwYu

Mr. Lüttmann will be responsible for the entire marketing and product management activities of the airline. Mr. Heusmann will be responsible for network planning as well as the management of prices and revenue at Austrian Airlines.

data.text: Following its new strategy program, Austrian Airlines is merging business units. Effective February 1, Sebastian Lüttmann will serve as head of “Austrian Brand Experience”. Robert Heusmann will assume the position as head of “Network Management & Revenue Steering”. https://t.co/BrRDXUNRAx

Two more beautiful sunset shots @flughafen_wien for some #MondayMotivation. As a tough year for everyone is slowly coming to a close, we are certain that the sun will shine brightly on all of us once again very soon. Stay strong and healthy! 💪 😷 ✌️ https://t.co/glKlYR8RR0

data.text: Die #airtaxis sind los. #flightcast hat mit @facc_ag, @frequentis & @austro_control darüber gesprochen wie #drohnen gebaut, für die Luftraumüberwachung genutzt werden & über die rechtlichen Standards dazu.🚁Hier reinhören: https://t.co/gfKGf5Ka24 https://t.co/ydhJxPS7UE

The vacant position of CFO will be assumed by @AHoensbroech as of 1 January 2021 in addition to his role as CEO. The future Executive Board of Austrian Airlines will thus consist of Alexis von Hoensbroech as CEO & CFO alongside CCO Michael Trestl and COO Francesco Sciortino. https://t.co/ppDkKg2spW

@JensRitter_JR, Chief Operating Officer of Austrian Airlines, will leave the company at the end of March 2021. He will assume the role of the new Chief Operating Officer and Member of the Executive Board of @eurowings in Germany. https://t.co/jFJ93eapwK

Andreas Otto, currently Austrian’s Chief Commercial Officer and Chief Financial Officer, has decided to leave the company at his own request effective 31 December 2020 in order to pursue new challenges. https://t.co/bxXh9PzP3S

There will be a change in the composition of our Executive Board. Contingent upon the approval of the Austrian Airlines Supervisory Board, Michael Trestl will become the new Chief Commercial Officer. Francesco Sciortino has been nominated as next Chief Operating Officer. https://t.co/jFUljyuA8c
How many snowflakes do you count in the picture? Let us know! 😉 Thanks Stefan Schwarz for this winterly looking snapshot. #WednesdayThought https://t.co/zJBsyoKNnR

One of the last sunsets for our Bombardier Q400 OE-LGA @flughafen_wien. Yesterday we handed it over to its new owner. Thanks for the many years of reliable service, take care and always happy landings! 👋 https://t.co/WtdmrKB8kN
RT @lufthansaNews: For more flexible travel plans 🛫: All airline fares can be rebooked as often as desired free of charge up to February 28…

data.text: RT @MichaelCsoklich: Todays first @_austrian flight VIE - BER #Flightcast @AHoensbroech @t_gru @Flugthier @flughafen_wien @BER_flughafen @L…
8:45 a.m. today: one small touchdown for a plane - one giant leap for us @berlinairport 🛬💪💪💪 #helloBER https://t.co/i6bXylxvHz

Our last flight from Berlin #TXL departed yesterday as OS236 shortly after 7:30 p.m. One last and heartfelt #Servus and #DankeTXL from our crew and everybody at Austrian Airlines for the many decades of service! 👋👋👋❤️❤️❤️ https://t.co/JULPy6qtPq

The pilot phase of the mandatory COVID-19 tests is currently scheduled to last until the end of November 2020 and takes place in close cooperation with @lufthansaNews as well as @flughafen_wien and @HamburgAirport. Visit our website for more information: https://t.co/0UurhuyS5m https://t.co/iPnpNo9oLj

data.text: "About 25 percent of passengers volunteered to have themselves tested in the first phase”, says our COO @JensRitter_JR. “Our objective is to make quarantine regulations obsolete on the basis of a sophisticated testing strategy. Mandatory tests are a further step on this path." https://t.co/xv8rx1W507

data.text: The testing program is a Lufthansa Group-wide pilot project. It aims to enable intercontinental mobility and freedom of travel while maintaining health protection. If the trial runs become well established, we may offer the tests on a larger scale and extend them to other routes. https://t.co/owvjrYjrSR

data.text: If the result is positive, the the airport medical service will take care of the passenger to fully clarify the his or her medical condition. Further steps will be specified with the health authorities. Affected passengers can rebook or cancel their Austrian flights at no cost. https://t.co/HpYjfxwL4l

Passengers will receive their results within 10-15 minutes, either via SMS or, upon request, after consulting medically trained staff. The boarding card is only activated if the test result is negative, enabling the passenger to enter the security area and gate. https://t.co/TvxnCPgmo4

data.text: We are starting the next testing phase on flights between Vienna and Hamburg (OS171/2) to integrate COVID-19 rapid antigen tests in the travel chain. Free of charge tests will be obligatory for passengers and crew ensuring everyone on board has tested negative for COVID-19. https://t.co/vYWSLNQYS4

data.text: Pressekonferenz Q3 | 2020 https://t.co/WCdwlGa2PS

Accordingly, the adjusted EBIT for the first nine months of 2020 equaled minus EUR 341 million. The number of passengers transported by Austrian Airlines fell by 75 percent to about 2.8 million due to the many travel restrictions which have been imposed.

As a consequence of the second COVID-19 wave and the related adjustments to flight operations, Austrian Airlines reported an adjusted EBIT of minus EUR 106 million in the third quarter of 2020 compared to the positive results of EUR 70 million in the prior-year quarter.

data.text:
We are deeply shocked by the terrorist attack in Vienna and our thoughts are with the victims and injured of the attack, as well as their families. Vienna is our hometown and we always carry Austria in our hearts. 

We stick together. 

Especially now.

#StaySafe https://t.co/VneabpChG0

data.text: Austrian Airlines already offers AIRail on the routes from Vienna Airport to Linz and Salzburg with over 30 daily connections each. Customers will enjoy various advantages when they book an AIRail connection, for example a guaranteed connecting service.

We are expanding our "Train to Plane" offer together with @unsereOEBB by another route. From 13 December 2020, four trains with an Austrian flight number will run daily between Graz Central Station and Vienna Airport. The connections chosen will complement our flight schedule. https://t.co/qWbtXnqnKT

data.text: Photo credit @flughafen_wien

Zusammen mit dem @flughafen_wien haben wir letzte Woche unser Schnelltest-Pilotprojekt gestartet. #antigen #schnelltests sollen zukünftig Reisefreiheit & Infektionsschutz vereinen. #flightcast hat COO @JensRitter_JR & FWAG Vorstand Julian Jäger befragt: https://t.co/4o7S9v4Bsz 🎙️ https://t.co/Ff7JZPu4Kx
VIE RWY 34 is correct! Stay tuned for our last and most beautiful landing quiz next week.

Here's another quiz for you: At which airport do we land here? Hint: This one shouldn't be too hard for anyone who knows us a little.😉 State the correct runway again if you can! #ThursdayThoughts https://t.co/Ewj6IyUKM2

Happy #NationalDayAustria! 🇦🇹 
No matter if summer or winter, in the cities or the countryside, at the lakes or in the mountains – you are simply beautiful! ❤️ 

Which is your favorite city in Austria? And which would you like to discover next? Tell us below. ⤵️ #Nationalfeiertag https://t.co/bn1h2yfp79

data.text: RT @AHoensbroech: Startschuss für unser Schnelltest Projekt.👈🏻👌🏼 Ab heute können Passagiere auf unserem Flug OS229 kostenlos & freiwillig #…
Further steps will be specified with the responsible health authorities. In this case, the passenger will be able to rebook or cancel his or her Austrian Airlines flight free of charge.

The boarding card is only activated if the results are negative, enabling the passenger to enter the security area and gate. If the results are positive, the affected passenger will be taken care by the airport medical service to fully clarify the individual’s medical condition.

data.text: Initially, all passengers on flight OS 229 from Vienna to Berlin will have the opportunity to take a rapid test prior to departure from 23 October to 8 November. Passengers will receive their results within 10-15 minutes, either via SMS or, upon request, after personal inquiry.

We have started the first trials for using rapid Covid-19 antigen tests in close cooperation with @flughafen_wien. Our COO @JensRitter_JR tried it already as you can see below. The tests are free of charge and are carried out on a voluntary basis. https://t.co/66yi9NYzfB

data.text: The health and protection of our passengers and crew is always our first priority. That's why wearing a full-face mask during your trip with us is compulsory. Face shields or FFP2/FFP3 masks with a valve are not permitted on board. 😷 #WeCare https://t.co/CQsU3EiZQx

data.text: Good news at the end of the week. 📰 The Executive Board Contract of our CEO @AHoensbroech has been extended for another five years until 2026. Alexis, we are looking forward to working together with you for many more.🤝 #teamaustrian https://t.co/XIM3f3z8RB
RT @AHoensbroech: Flugzeug checked.👌🏼✈️ In den nächsten Wochen wird uns die  #b777 OE-LPF in Richtung Arizona verlassen & dort den Winter v…

Trotz Coronakrise ist Kurzarbeit aktuell bei @frequentis kein Thema. „Wir laufen auf Volllast“, berichtet Frequentis CEO Norbert Haslacher in der aktuellen Folge von #Flightcast. 🎤Die neue Folge jetzt anhören: https://t.co/QRqCacjap1 (Podcast available in German only) https://t.co/33XWCXlE0M

data.text: Weltweit leiden auch Flughäfen unter #Covid-19. #Flightcast sprach mit dem Vorstand Julian Jäger und Günther Ofner über das Problem der zersplitterten Reisebestimmungen, die Folgen von Corona und die Zukunftspläne für die AirportCity. https://t.co/bag8rRqeUq (German Podcast) https://t.co/3As51USypq

data.text: On 29 September our Austrian Business Lounge Schengen @flughafen_wien will open again. The food and drink on offer complies with all hygiene requirements and has been adapted to meet official guidelines. Mouth and nose protection may only be removed while seated at the tables. https://t.co/wysveMQ7SZ

On 2 October we will restart our route from Vienna to Shanghai once a week! Further connections to China are a conceivable option for Austrian Airlines. With this step, we join @lufthansaNews and @FlySWISS thus offering the complete Group package to and from Shanghai again. 💪😊 https://t.co/5rKyHBvm9B

data.text: Sunset @flughafen_wien ... 😍📷 https://t.co/QTS7zqxuDk

As Austria's national carrier, we are proud to connect the world with Austria's immensely famous #ForestCities! Explore our arboreous country virtually on our #AustrianBlog: https://t.co/bCAGlGShfl #ServusForestCities #Waldstädte 😁 https://t.co/dxDUjSfVPa

After an epic @usopen final, it was a great honor to have the champ on board today! Congratulations to @ThiemDomi, @massunico and the whole team! We are all mighty proud of you! 🏆👏👏👏 https://t.co/mfiPYujbTp

data.text: Our flying classroom is back! After a six month break we hosted our first group of visitors today - 25 curious pupils. @AHoensbroech, Günther Ofner from @flughafen_wien and state secretary Magnus Brunner welcomed them. Tours in our hangar can be booked at https://t.co/Zt4BTrRdpP. https://t.co/QX9IiNVFe8
Unserem Hörer @BMLoidl speziell  gewidmet. Danke auch für die Empfehlung, @Frequentis zu interviewen. 😊

Ausfallsicher und verständlich - das sind die wichtigsten Anforderungen an die Kommunikation im Bereich Flugsicherung. #Flightcast ist diesmal beim Weltmarktführer @Frequentis zu Gast (podcast in German only): https://t.co/zGM8nNBN0m https://t.co/kXhtXIkadU
